suggestedNewContent.title: Think of It Like a Magazine Layout
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Compare Instagram feed to a magazine: stories are like headlines at the top, posts are like articles with images, the grid explore page is like a photo gallery section. Explain how we compose these using Flutter widgets.

suggestedNewContent.title: Building the Post Widget
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Step-by-step code example creating a PostWidget with: 1) Row for author avatar and name, 2) Image.network or placeholder for post image, 3) Row with IconButtons for like/comment/share, 4) Text for caption and comments count. Use Stack for overlays like story indicators.

suggestedNewContent.title: Creating the Stories Bar
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Implement horizontal ScrollView with CircleAvatar widgets, gradient border effect for unseen stories using Container with gradient decoration, ListView.builder for story items.

suggestedNewContent.title: Assembling the Feed
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Combine StoriesBar and ListView.builder of PostWidgets into a complete feed. Show CustomScrollView with SliverAppBar for collapsing header, SliverList for posts.

suggestedNewContent.title: Explore Page Grid
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Build responsive GridView using LayoutBuilder with adaptive column count. Show GridView.builder with SliverGridDelegateWithMaxCrossAxisExtent for flexible grids.

suggestedNewContent.title: Common Feed Performance Mistakes
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: 1) Using ListView instead of ListView.builder for long lists (memory issues), 2) Not caching network images, 3) Building complex widgets inside itemBuilder, 4) Forgetting keys on list items causing rebuild issues, 5) Not using const constructors

suggestedNewContent.title: Feed Architecture Best Practices
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Explain component separation: PostWidget, StoryWidget, FeedScreen. Discuss lazy loading with ListView.builder, image caching strategies, and when to use CustomScrollView with Slivers for complex scroll effects.

summary: This lesson is critically incomplete. Despite the title 'Mini-Project - Instagram-Style Feed', it contains only theoretical bullet points and NO actual implementation code. The lesson promises stories, posts, like buttons, and responsive grids but delivers none of these. The single challenge is about adaptive grids (not Instagram feed) and has formatting errors. For a mini-project lesson, learners expect to build something substantial - this lesson fails to deliver on its promise. Immediate content expansion is required.
